newsitem.title: FRANCE: PSA Peugeot Citroen 1996 sales up 5.1 pct.
newsitem.headline: PSA Peugeot Citroen 1996 sales up 5.1 pct.

text.p: (All figures in millions of French francs)
NOTE - PSA Peugeot Citroen gave its 1996 sales in a statement. It said they were up 5.1 percent, or 4.9 percent on a like-for-like basis, over the previous year.
Turnover in the auto division rose 5.6 percent, or 5.3 percent on a like-for-like basis.
Sales in France last year totalled 75.19 billion francs, up 1.1 percent, and sales abroad were 97.48 billion, up 8.4 percent.
Unit sales worldwide rose 7.6 percent to 2,006,100.
The PSA group said its car sales in western Europe totalled 1,528,900 units, up six percent, in 1996. Its share of the market was 11.93 percent, compared with 11.97 percent for 1995.
Its light commercial vehicle sales rose 14.2 percent to 208,700 in western Europe and its market share rose to 15.2 percent from 14.1 percent in 1995.
Sales of vehicules outside western Europe rose 15 percent in 1996 to 260,500 units.
